entities.description: Problems with family or friends caused or made worse by heroin use.
Loss of important social, occupational, or recreational activities due to heroin use.
Situations where using heroin increased physical harm risks.
Continued use of heroin despite causing emotional, mental, or physical health problems.
Needing more heroin to achieve the desired effect or reduced effect from the same amount.
Symptoms experienced after reduced or stopped heroin use, indicating withdrawal.
Repeated use of hallucinogens in larger amounts or for longer periods than intended.
Failed attempts to cut down or stop hallucinogen use.
Significant time spent on using, feeling effects of, or getting over hallucinogen use.

relationships.description: Heroin use causing or worsening problems with family or friends.
Heroin use leading to the loss of important activities.
Heroin use increasing chances of physical harm.
Continued heroin use despite damaging emotional, mental, or physical health.
Increased heroin use to achieve the desired effect or reduced effect from the same amount.
Withdrawal symptoms due to reduced or stopped heroin use.
Repeated hallucinogen use in larger amounts or longer periods than intended.
Failed attempts to cut down or stop hallucinogen use.
Significant time spent on using or dealing with effects of hallucinogens.
